title: Lady Gaga the albino snake puts on final show after 17 years as tourist park favourite | ABC NEWS
description: A celebrity serpent named Lady Gaga is retiring this week after 17 years as a drawcard at the Northern Territory Wildlife Park, outside of Darwin. While staff and visitors are sad to see Lady Gaga go, the albino python is set to enjoy the rest of her days in peace while a new star slithers into her shoes. By Tilda Colling for ABC News Northern Territory.   Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Fresh melioidosis infections in North Qld spark public health warning | ABC NEWS
description: Four people from across the Mackay and Whitsunday regions have been hospitalised with the potentially fatal soil-borne disease melioidosis. Health authorities say all four of the people affected had been exposed to mud or recent floodwaters. Dr Steven Donohue says people at most risk of infection are already unwell, elderly, or have existing chronic conditions. He's urging flood-affected residents to be cautious during clean-up and vigilant for symptoms. title: Trump's erratic policies drive gold to another record high | Finance Report | ABC NEWS
description: The price of gold has jumped above $US4,900 for the first time ever.  Since the year began, Donald Trump ordered the capture of Venezuela's president Nicolas Maduro and threatened to impose tariffs on goods on eight European nations until Greenland was sold to the United States.  That led to a sell-off across Wall Street and the US dollar earlier this week. The US President quickly reversed his tariff decision and said he would not order a military takeover of Greenland.  All that instability has been good for gold prices, as finance presenter David Chau explains. title: China watching marriage numbers to measure economic growth | The World | ABC NEWS
description: China says its economy has hit its five per cent growth target for the year, but its birth rate continues to shrink.  Loughlin Patrick reports the government's watching marriage numbers to see if a wedding rebound is here to stay, hoping it could lead to more births and higher spending. title: Sussan Ley downplays Nationals' split, vows to remain Liberal leader | ABC NEWS
description: Sussan Ley says she will remain as Liberal leader after a split with the Nationals, and remains open to a reunion but is not focused on it. Nationals leader David Littleproud has blamed Ms Ley for the split, which he announced on the day of mourning on Thursday. title: Pregnant woman among three shot dead at Lake Cargelligo in country NSW | ABC NEWS
description: *A warning, the following story contains the names of Indigenous people who have died.* A manhunt has entered its second night following a triple murder in country New South Wales. Police say it's a case of domestic violence with a young pregnant woman among the victims of the shooting. The suspected gunman was out on bail and due to face court in February, charged with stalking and intimidation. title: Police investigate threatening letter sent to Lakemba Mosque | ABC NEWS
description: Police have described a race hate letter sent to the Lakemba Mosque in Western Sydney as "abhorrent" and promised a swift investigation. The letter, addressed to the Imam of the mosque, calls for multicultural groups and anyone protesting Australia Day to be "beaten to death". It's been strongly condemned by both the NSW premier and federal government. title: Six confirmed missing in landslide at New Zealand's Mount Maunganui | ABC NEWS
description: Authorities have worked through the night to try to find people trapped by a landslide in New Zealand.  Specialist officers used heavy earthmoving equipment to try and find those under the rubble at the campsite at Mount Maunganui.  Police say they have located the bodies of two people who were killed in another landslide in the Bay of Plenty region at Welcome Bay. title: Former SA leader’s comeback in doubt as funding ruled out | Stateline | ABC NEWS
description: Former SA Liberal Party leader David Speirs is not eligible to receive public campaign funding if he chooses to run at the upcoming election, the state's electoral commission says. Speirs resigned from parliament in October 2024 while facing drugs charges, but has yet to declare whether he will run. Constitutional law expert Joe McIntyre says Speirs's drug supply convictions mean he is ineligible to nominate for election. title: Federal Court finds Vic. Police stop-and-search declaration was unlawful | ABC NEWS
description: The Federal Court has ruled Victoria Police's decision to declare Melbourne's CBD a designated area for six months was invalid and unlawful. The declaration gave police more stop and search powers. The ruling followed a legal and constitutional challenge the Human Rights Law Centre mounted against Victoria Police in 2025. title: March for Australia admins promoted Neo-Nazi party | ABC NEWS Verify
description: With the new federal hate speech laws introduced, the Neo-Nazi National Socialist Network says it disbanded.  However an ABC NEWS Verify investigation has uncovered posts from March for Australia administrators openly directing followers to join the now-defunct Neo-Nazi White Australia party. description: Fires are continuing to threaten a number of communities in southern Western Australia, with more than 150 firefighters and a number of aircraft fighting serious fires near Boddington, Wandering and Bannister south of Perth.
